block.p: Because of an editing error, a front-page article on Saturday about differing accounts of the travels of an Atlanta lawyer with a dangerous form of tuberculosis misattributed comments about the Italian Health Ministry's contacts with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta. It was Cesare Fassari, a spokesman for the ministry, who told a reporter that Dr. Maria Grazia Pompa, the head of its tuberculosis surveillance program, ''contacted the C.D.C. and said, 'Weren't you supposed to contact us?' '' Mr. Fassari also said, ''At that time, the disease centers confirmed that there was a case but did not provide details.'' The comments were not made to the reporter by Dr. Pompa.
